articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives Reply Message from Chinese Leaders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Reply Message from Chinese Leaders

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, and Choe Yong Rim, premier of the Cabinet, on Oct. 10 received a message sent by Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and president of China, Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, and Wen Jiabao, premier of the State Council, in reply to their message of greeting.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 Please accept our thanks to you for sending a message warmly congratulating us on the 62nd anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China.
					
					 The party and government of China will continue directing sustained efforts to boosting the Sino-DPRK relations of friendship and cooperation.
					
					 The Chinese side will join the DPRK side in making concerted efforts to inject fresh dynamism and vitality into the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship in the new period and under the new situation and bring well-being to the two countries and peoples. 
					
					 It is our sincere hope that the party, government and people of the DPRK will register fresh greater successes in the overall work for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts Japan's Planned Replacement of Air SDF's Prototype Fighter
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts Japan's Planned Replacement of Air SDF's Prototype Fighter 
						

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The Japan Air "Self-Defence Force" has become earnest in its moves to replace its prototype fighter.
					
					 The Japan Defence Ministry set up a "planning team" for selecting prototype fighter in January. It is set to decide its type within this year.
					
					 The ministry already finished the collection of proposals for prototype fighters from manufacturing companies on Sept. 26.
					
					 Japan is mulling the fifth generation fighter F-35 out of three proposed types.
					
					 According to an Oct. 2 report, F-35 Lightning 2 is highly likely to be selected following the ease of conditions on the part of the U.S.
					
					 Lockheed Martin Company, the biggest U.S. military monopoly, opened to the Japanese media the production process of Stealth F-35 Lightning 2 in mid August.
					
					 There is wide-spread contention over the skyrocketing price of the fighter but Japan still attempts purchasing dozens of it.
					
					 This shows that it attaches importance to the replacement of the prototype fighter, a reflection of the island country's militarist ambition for reinvasion. 
					
					 It is Japan's calculation that introduction of multi-purpose Stealth fighter like F-35 can provide favorable conditions for realizing its ambition for aggression with air superiority. 
					
					 Japan seeks to secure capability of carrying out any combat action independently in the Asia-Pacific region by renewing prototype fighters.
					
					 Some time ago, the chairman of the Political Council of the Democratic Party of Japan called for extended scope of use of weapons by the "Self-Defense Forces" in its overseas operation. Meanwhile the defense minister openly demanded the reexamination of the three principles of arms export. 
					
					 Japan is purchasing various types of combat technical equipment from the U.S. out of its ambition to step up the modernization of military equipment necessary for realizing its bid for a military power and launch in real earnest a war for overseas aggression.
					
					 At the same time, it is pushing ahead with the drive to put the military equipment on a modern and high-performance basis. 
					
					 It is steadily increasing overseas operation capacity through replacing military equipment with long-range one. 
					
					 Now Japan is vying with the world's military giants in production of arms and the level of SDF's military equipment is very high. 
					
					 On this basis the SDF's operation sphere is expanding more and more in the areas surrounding Japan. 
					
					 All these are a precondition for overseas aggression. 
					
					 Japan's bid for reinvasion will leads to its destruction.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Lao Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Lao Ministry Delegation

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, had a talk with the delegation of the Lao Ministry of Information, Culture and Tourism led by Minister Bosengkham Vongdara when the latter paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.
					
					 The head of the delegation said that the meeting between President Choummaly Sayasone and general secretary Kim Jong Il in September was a great event in developing the friendly relations between the two parties and countries provided by President Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 We hope that the Korean people would register greater success in the efforts to defend the country, build socialism and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il, he said.
					
					 He expressed the will to boost exchange and cooperation in information and thus contribute to strengthening the friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Gift from Lao Delegation
articles.content:
Gift from Lao Delegation 
						

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- General secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by visiting delegation of the Ministry of Information, Culture and Tourism of Laos.
					
					 The gift was handed over to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, by Minister of Information, Culture and Tourism Bosengkham Vongdara Friday.

articles.title: Japanese Party Delegation Tours Pyongyang
articles.content:
Japanese Party Delegation Tours Pyongyang 

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the New Socialist Party of Japan led by Eiko Tomiyama, vice-president of the Party Central Executive Committee and director of the Measure Department for Korean Peninsula Issue, visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and the members of the revolutionary Mangyongdae family at the old home of the President, the guests looked round relics preserved with care.
					
					 They had a photo taken to commemorate their visit.
					
					 The delegation also visited dwelling houses in Mansudae Street.
					
					 The houses are furnished for the convenience of the people, the head of the delegation said, adding she envies the ordinary people living in the houses equipped with all conditions.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, Pyongyang Metro and the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace.

articles.title: Lao Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Lao Delegation Visits Mangyongdae 

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Lao Ministry of Information, Culture and Tourism led by Minister Bosengkham Vongdara visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Friday.
					
					 Being briefed on the historic old home where the President was born and cherished the lofty idea of revolution while spending his childhood, the guests looked round the relics at the home. 
					
					 They posed for a picture in front of the old home.
					
					 The delegation also toured the e-library at Kim Il Sung University, the International Friendship Exhibition House and other places.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to PM of Denmark
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to PM of Denmark 

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim Friday sent a congratulatory message to Helle Thorning Schmidt on her appointment as prime minister of Denmark. 
					
					 The message wished her success in the work for prosperity of the country and welfare of its people.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to Villy Sondal on the same day on his appointment as foreign minister of Denmark.

articles.title: Modern Apparatus Applied to Mastopathy Treatment in DPRK
articles.content:
Modern Apparatus Applied to Mastopathy Treatment in DPRK

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- A modern mastopathy treatment apparatus has been widely introduced in public health establishments, including the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital.
					
					 The physio-treatment apparatus is suitable to the constitutional peculiarity of the Korean women.
					
					 The computer-controlled apparatus treats the disease by selecting a wave proper to patient's symptom and physical constitution.
					
					 The up-to-date appliance has enjoyed popularity among doctors and patients.
					
					 It is easy to use and gives no mental and physical exhaustion to patients.

articles.title: New Literary Books Off Press
articles.content:
New Literary Books Off Press 

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The Korea Literature and Art Publishing House recently published new literary books of different themes.
					
					 Among them is a collection of piano accompaniments "Recollection of 20th Century" containing 38 popular songs, including masterpieces "Nostalgia" and "O Korea, I Will Add Glory to Thee." 
					
					 "Successive Appeals", the 86th part of Selected Works of Korean Classical Literature, includes 54 typical appeals, along with the introductions of their authors, original and translated texts and comments.     
					
					 "Works of Lady Writers before Country's Liberation" is the 47th part of Selected Works of Modern Korean Literature. 
					
					 "Man Jok I" contains 20 historical stories about the struggle waged by the army and people against invasion and feudalism and for independence, and about famous patriotic generals and other celebrated men.

articles.title: FTA with U.S. Strongly Opposed in S. Korea
articles.content:
FTA with U.S. Strongly Opposed in S. Korea 

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon,) the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and other civic and social organizations in south Korea held the 145th action for independent reunification and peace on October 11 outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul.
					
					 The organizations accused the authorities of stepping up the moves for concluding the humiliating FTA with the U.S.
					
					 It is clear from the contents of the agreement that south Korea has no right to complain to the U.S. court over issues arising in trade.
					
					 The inequality in the terms of the FTA is beyond imagination as proven by the fact that all business activities are subject to the U.S. acts.
					
					 The organizations deplored that the SOFA which prevents courts of south Korea from properly punishing those GI criminals against its people clearly shows the unequal relations between the U.S. and south Korea.
					
					 To put an end to these unequal relations it is necessary to resolutely oppose the FTA, totally revise the humiliating SOFA and force the U.S. forces to quit south Korea, they held.
					
					 Then they thrust a protest letter to the U.S. embassy.
					
					 Meanwhile, the opposition parties and civic organizations in south Korea held a meeting on October 12 outside the building of the puppet National Assembly at which they clarified their will to block the moves for the conclusion of the FTA, according to the south Korean KBS.

articles.title: S. Korean Unification Ministry's Launch of Anti-DPRK Broadcasting Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Civic and Public Organizations Urge U.S. to Make Apology for GIs' Crimes

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Personages of civic and public organizations of south Korea at a press conference outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Oct. 11 condemned the crimes committed by the U.S. imperialist aggression forces in south Korea.
					
					 Speakers said GIs' crimes greatly hurt the south Koreans.
					
					 GIs' crimes remain unabated as the criminals end up with impunity under the south Korea-U.S. "Status of Forces Agreement" (SOFA), they deplored.
					
					 They urged the U.S. president to apologize before the south Koreans for the recent case and opt for revising the shackling SOFA.
					
					 At the end of the conference they thrust a protest letter signed by 1,000 representatives of the organizations to the U.S. embassy.

articles.title: Pullout of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Urged
articles.content:
Pullout of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Urged 

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in south Korea should stop hideous human rights abuses violating the dignity of the Korean nation and go back home at once, urges Minju Joson Friday in a by-lined commentary.
					
					 It says:
					
					 Recent series of sexual assaults against south Korean women by GIs have touched off bitter condemnation and wrath from all the Korean people.
					
					 Soon after the incident the U.S. busied itself, expressing regret, ordering a curfew and allegedly investigating the case. But this was a clumsy farce to calm down the south Koreans' mounting anti-American feelings.
					
					 If the U.S. truly feels responsible for those crimes and guilty conscience for misfortune and pains of the south Koreans, it should hand over the criminals to the south Korean authorities and inflict heavy penalty upon them. The U.S., however, denies the extradition of the criminals under the pretext of the south Korea-U.S. "Status of Forces Agreement."
					
					 It is clear that it would hush up the case under this or that pretext while dragging on the investigation of the case as in the past.
					
					 What is at issue is how long the south Koreans have to live in fear and agony subject to contempt and humiliation by the U.S. forces.
					
					 Increase of GIs' crimes is unavoidable as the U.S. considers south Korea as its colony and it is fixed by law.
					
					 The pullout of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces from south Korea is the way for the south Koreans to get rid of all misfortune and pains caused by GIs.

articles.title: Authorities' Suppression of Progressive Organization Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Suppression of Progressive Organization Flailed in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea denounced the puppet group for its harsh suppression of the organization. It issued a statement on Oct. 10.
					
					 The prosecution authorities recently reclaimed the examination of the arrest warrants for the co-chairman, the secretary general and other members of the organization, the statement said, adding:
					
					 The arrest warrants for them submitted by the prosecution in May on charges of the violation of the "National Security Law" (SL) were turned down because of the lack of evidence, a clear proof for the prosecution's harsh suppression.
					
					 The prosecution is again raising the issue, saying they violated the SL.
					
					 This is a trite hoax cooked up by the authorities to tide over serious ruling crisis.
					
					 The recent clampdown is aimed to bar the progressive forces from achieving solidarity and alliance with the Oct. 26 election to the Seoul mayor just around the corner.
					
					 The statement urged the present regime and the prosecution to immediately stop the crackdown on the members of the Solidarity.

articles.title: S. Korean Civic and Public Organizations Urge U.S. to Make Apology for GIs' Crimes
articles.content:
S. Korean Civic and Public Organizations Urge U.S. to Make Apology for GIs' Crimes

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Personages of civic and public organizations of south Korea at a press conference outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Oct. 11 condemned the crimes committed by the U.S. imperialist aggression forces in south Korea.
					
					 Speakers said GIs' crimes greatly hurt the south Koreans.
					
					 GIs' crimes remain unabated as the criminals end up with impunity under the south Korea-U.S. "Status of Forces Agreement" (SOFA), they deplored.
					
					 They urged the U.S. president to apologize before the south Koreans for the recent case and opt for revising the shackling SOFA.
					
					 At the end of the conference they thrust a protest letter signed by 1,000 representatives of the organizations to the U.S. embassy.

articles.title: Police Suppression of Journalists Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Police Suppression of Journalists Denounced in S. Korea 

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Press Trade Union, the Journalists Association and the Internet Journalists Association issued a joint statement on Oct. 10 denouncing the puppet police for its suppression of journalists.
					
					 The police crackdown on journalists who were covering rallies and demonstrations has gone beyond the tolerance limit these days, said the statement.
					
					 The police whisked off a journalist who was covering the protest against the construction of a naval base in Kangjong Village on Jeju Island on Oct. 4.
					
					 On Oct. 8 cameramen taking video of the struggle for the settlement of Hanjin Heavy Industrial Co. Ltd. issue in Pusan were arrested. The police even fired tear gas on a photographer of the "Voice of People" the same day, putting him in a faint.
					
					 The suppression of the journalists in their legitimate news coverage on charges of the violation of the "law on assembly and demonstration" is a violation of the freedom of press, it said, adding:
					
					 The police repressive campaign is by no means an accidental one but an organized and premeditated crackdown on the progressive news agencies.
					
					 The statement urged Chief of Police Agency Jo Hyon O to apologize for the reckless suppression of journalists and sternly punish those related to it.

articles.title: Resignation of S. Korean Vice-Minister of Unification Urged
articles.content:
Resignation of S. Korean Vice-Minister of Unification Urged 

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Internet paper of Koreans in the U.S. Minjok Thongsin carried an article urging south Korean Vice Minister of Unification Om Jong Sik to step down, branding him as a pro-U.S. sycophantic element kowtowing to the U.S.
					
					 WikiLeaks recently disclosed that he had been active as an intelligence agent of the U.S., said the article.
					
					 Data he conveyed while frequenting the U.S. embassy were handled as special intelligence, it added.
					
					 It is hard to achieve the country's reunification as long as such pro-U.S. sycophantic traitors as Om are allowed to hold important posts of the "government," the article deplored.
					
					 It urged Om to resign at once for his crimes of having served the U.S. as its spy and servant.

articles.title: Punishment of S. Korean Conservative Group Demanded
articles.content:
Punishment of S. Korean Conservative Group Demanded

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement titled "Let us mete out deserved punishment to the conservative group of traitors" on Tuesday.
					
					 The statement said the Seoul mayoral election slated to take place on October 26 should be an occasion of sternly judging the traitorous and unpopular policy of the present conservative ruling forces. 
					
					 The "Grand National Party's" seizure of power brought serious misfortune to the south Korean people, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 The clan of the GNP is a group of traitors who sells off everything if it will help prolong its remaining days, backed by its U.S. and Japanese masters.
					
					 Noting that grudge and wrath against the GNP are growing stronger among the south Korean people as the days go by, the statement went on:
					
					 All parties, organizations and people that aspire after independence, democracy and reunification and new politics and society should inflict a bitter defeat upon the GNP in the coming election.
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China and all Koreans in China fully support the anti-GNP struggle of the people from all walks of life in south Korea and will join them in the struggle for ousting the group of traitors from power.
					
					 A spokesperson for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China in a statement issued on October 5 called for inflicting a bitter defeat upon the south Korean group of traitors to the nation.

articles.title: U.S. Military Reinforcement in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Military Reinforcement in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist warmongers recently brought 12 F-16C fighters into the Kunsan U.S. air base in south Korea.
					
					 Those fighters belonging to the 419th and 388th air divisions under the U.S. Air Force were deployed with about 200 troops.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are intensifying the war preparations for aggression on the DPRK while beefing up the U.S. forces present in south Korea with latest weapons for preemptive attack.

articles.title: Early Normalization of DPRK-Japan Relations Called for in Japan
articles.content:
Early Normalization of DPRK-Japan Relations Called for in Japan

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Japanese organizations sent a written request to the Japanese prime minister and foreign minister on Sept. 29 demanding an earlier normalization of the DPRK-Japan relations. They included the Japanese Women's Society for Solidarity with the Korean Women, the Japan-Korea Cultural Interchange Association and the Kanagawa Prefectural Citizens Society for Promoting the Normalization of Japan-DPRK Relations.
					
					 The request said that the liquidation of the inglorious past between Japan and the DPRK is an essential process for bright prospect and a course leading to denuclearization and peace in Northeast Asia.
					
					 It called for immediately resuming the talks for the normalization of the relations between the two countries to realize it till autumn in 2012 which marks the 10th anniversary of the Pyongyang Declaration.
					
					 To this end, it is necessary to lift the sanctions against the DPRK and create an atmosphere of resuming the dialogue, it stressed.
					
					 Conveying the request Sumiko Shimizu, representative of the Women's Society for Solidarity with the Korean Women, on the same day asserted that solution to the issue between the two countries should start with Japan's settlement of its past.

articles.title: Iran Rejects U.S. Claims over Its Alleged Plot to Assassin Saudi Ambassador
articles.content:
Iran Rejects U.S. Claims over Its Alleged Plot to Assassin Saudi Ambassador

					 Tehran, October 13 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for Iran's Foreign Ministry rejected Tuesday the U.S. accusations that the Islamic Republic had plotted to assassin the Saudi ambassador to Washington, the semi-official Fars news agency reported. 
					
					 The U.S. accusations are "incorrect" and "prefabricated scenario", the spokesman said, adding that such kinds of allegations are "ridiculous shows" aimed at creating discord among the regional countries.
					
					 Such claims will not affect the public opinion, concluded the spokesman.

articles.title: Palestinians Call for Releasing Prisoners in Israeli Jail
articles.content:
Palestinians Call for Releasing Prisoners in Israeli Jail 

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Wassel Abu Yousef, a member of Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO) executive committee, at a press conference on Oct. 11 strongly demanded the Israeli authorities release all the Palestinian and Arab prisoners from Israeli jails.
					
					 Referring to a series of massive demonstrations everyday for releasing the prisoners, Abu Yousef said that it is just the unanimous demands of all the Palestinians.
					
					 "The prisoners must be immediately released without any conditions," Abu Yousef said, adding that the PLO has been holding intensive regional and international contacts with all human rights organizations to follow up the prisoners' cause and their hunger strike.

articles.title: Suez Canal Reaps 3.9 Billion Dollars in First Nine Months
articles.content:
Suez Canal Reaps 3.9 Billion Dollars in First Nine Months

					 Cairo, October 13 (KCNA) -- Egypt reaps incomes through its Suez Canal.
					
					 Egypt's Suez Canal garnered 3.9 billion U.S. dollars in the first nine months of this year, slightly more than the same period last year, according to the Suez Canal Authority.
					
					 The waterway's revenue in September hit 438.3 million dollars, up 6.9 percent year-on-year but down 7.3 percent from August.

articles.title: Choleraic Casualties in African Countries
articles.content:
Choleraic Casualties in African Countries

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Cholera spreads in several countries in the central and western parts of Africa.
					
					 More than 85,000 people have suffered from cholera and 2,466 of them died this year according to the survey data released by the UNICEF on Tuesday.
					
					 Measures to stop the spread of the disease are taken by the relevant countries.

articles.title: Cooperation between Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation between Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- China and Vietnam on Tuesday signed an agreement on basic principles guiding the settlement of maritime issues existing between the two countries.
					
					 Ukraine and Slovenia have signed a number of agreements to further deepen cooperation in trade, customs and security on the same day.
					
					 Indonesia and Slovakia on Tuesday ended the 5th Business Meeting by signing 15 Memorandums of Understanding as an effort to increase bilateral ties in various sectors including agriculture, trade and education.

articles.title: China Chides U.S. Pressure
articles.content:
China Chides U.S. Pressure

					 Beijing, October 13 (KCNA) -- Ma Zhaoxu, spokesman of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China, at a press conference Wednesday, bitterly denounced the U.S. for putting pressure upon China over the issue of the RMB exchange rate.
					
					 The 2011 exchange rate supervision and reform bill recently examined and adopted by the U.S. Senate is aimed to take a measure for protectionism under the pretext of the currency imbalance, he said.  
					
					 This is in wanton violation of the World Trade Organization rules and will seriously affect the Sino-U.S. economic and trade relations, he warned.
					
					 China strongly opposes the intention of the U.S. government and Congress to put pressure by passing its domestic legislation on the issue of its Yuan's exchange rate and rejects their methods of politicizing the economic and trade relations and trade protectionism, he stressed.

articles.title: Cuba Calls on Rich Countries to Fulfill Commitments to Africa
articles.content:
Cuba Calls on Rich Countries to Fulfill Commitments to Africa

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The permanent representative of Cuba to the UN, speaking at a session of the General Assembly on Africa's development on Oct. 11, condemned the West for its exploit to African countries and interference in their internal affairs.
					
					 The representative denounced the unreasonable policies pursued by the West that force many countries in Africa to spend more resources on external debt payments than on health and education programs, calling for an immediate end to military interventions aimed at ensuring control of mineral resources in Africa.
					
					 Cuba will continue to support the AU and all regional coordination mechanisms, in an effort to find their own solutions to African problems, said the representative.

articles.title: West's Recent Decision to Impose Sanctions on Iran Rejected
articles.content:
West's Recent Decision to Impose Sanctions on Iran Rejected

					 Tehran, October 13 (KCNA) -- Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesperson denounced Tuesday the West's recent decision to slap sanctions on Iran.
					
					 As regards the West's decision to apply sanctions against 29 Iranian government officials, the spokesperson branded it as an improper and a politically-motivated measure aimed to put pressure on Iran.
					
					 The West presses Iran to give up its right, the spokesperson said, stressing that the West should respect the rights of other countries and not interfere in their internal affairs.

articles.title: Non-Partisan Protests in US Will Paralyze US Political Structure
articles.content:
Non-Partisan Protests in US Will Paralyze US Political Structure

					 Tehran, October 13 (KCNA) -- The current popular protests in US are non-partisan and will destroy Washington's political system, the head of Iran's Basij (volunteer forces) Mohammad Reza Naghdi said on Saturday.
					
					 Commenting on the current "Occupy Wall Street Movement" in U.S., the Basij commander said that the ongoing protests in the United State of America are deep and will not decline soon.

articles.title: Israeli Army Demolishes West Bank Mosque, Detains 6 Palestinians
articles.content:
Israeli Army Demolishes West Bank Mosque, Detains 6 Palestinians

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Israeli army demolished on Tuesday a mosque in northern West Bank and arrested six innocent Palestinians.
					
					 Earlier on Tuesday, clashes erupted in the old city of Hebron in southern West Bank between dozens of Palestinian schoolgirls and Israeli soldiers after the soldiers prevented them and their teachers from reaching their school.
					
					 The soldiers fired rubber bullets and tear gas to disperse the girls, injuring several of them.

articles.title: OECD Unemployment Rate Stable at 8.2 Pct in August
articles.content:
OECD Unemployment Rate Stable at 8.2 Pct in August

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Around 44.3 million people were unemployed across the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) area in August 2011 due to the persistent economic stagnation, according to monthly report released Tuesday by the Paris-based OECD.

articles.title: Many Corporate Bankruptcies in Japan
articles.content:
Many Corporate Bankruptcies in Japan

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The number of corporate bankruptcies involving debts of 10 million yen or more in the April-September period was 6,420, a credit research agency said Tuesday.
					
					 Debts left behind by the failed firms in the first six months of fiscal 2011 were 1.98 trillion yen, Tokyo Shoko Research said.

articles.title: Protest against Capitalist Exploitation Continues in U.S.
articles.content:
Protest against Capitalist Exploitation Continues in U.S. 

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Protest against the capitalists' exploitation and oppression continues in the U.S.
					
					 There were simultaneous demonstrations in 25 major cities of the U.S. including Washington, Philadelphia and Boston on Oct. 10.
					
					 The protesters were unanimous in their indignation at the economic inequality plaguing the society, blaming it on the cupidity of the capitalists.

articles.title: Protest in U.S. Reveals Root Problems of Its Society: Xinhua
articles.content:
Protest in U.S. Reveals Root Problems of Its Society: Xinhua

					 Beijing, October 13 (KCNA) -- Xinhua reported an article on the massive demonstration recently rampant in the U.S.
					
					 The protest, erupted in New York under the slogan "Occupy Wall Street", spread into many other cities of the U.S., the article noted, adding news analysts expect the campaign to grow stronger before long.
					
					 This demonstration revealed some of root problems disturbing the society of the U.S. as it was caused by political, social and economic difficulties affecting the U.S. as a whole, it said.
					
					 Americans are disappointed at the incompetent economic policy of the government while expressing their discontent with the political strife in U.S. Congress, it noted.
					
					 Analysts claim that this protest campaign may have an effect on the decision-making of the U.S. in the end, it said.

articles.title: Much Effort Should Be Paid to Improving People's Living: Official
articles.content:
Much Effort Should Be Paid to Improving People's Living: Official

					 Beijing, October 13 (KCNA) -- Li Keqiang, vice-premier of the Chinese State Council, called for paying much effort to improving the people's living standard.
					
					 During his recent inspection tour of Hunan Province, Li said improving the people's living is an important task of governments at all levels.
					
					 They should pay attention to solving the educational, housing, medical service and other issues related to the people's living in towns and villages, true to the instructions of the Central Committee of the Communist Party and the State Council, he added.

articles.title: Chinese People Urged to Learn from Ye Zhiping
articles.content:
Chinese People Urged to Learn from Ye Zhiping 

					 Beijing, October 13 (KCNA) -- Li Changchun, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, Tuesday called for following the spirit of Ye Zhiping.
					
					 Speaking at a meeting with members of the group for survey of Ye's good deeds in Beijing, Li said the whole society should be replete with the spirit of loving one's working place and job, respecting teachers and attaching importance to education.
					
					 Ye, who was a secondary school headmaster, devoted himself to education in a rural community for 36 years.

articles.title: Russian Prime Minister Visits China
articles.content:
Russian Prime Minister Visits China

					 Beijing, October 13 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin paid a two-day visit to China from Oct. 11.
					
					 During his visit Putin met with Chinese President Hu Jintao and Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress Wu Bangguo and had talks with his Chinese counterpart Wen Jiabao.
					
					 At the meetings and talks they discussed the issue of developing bilateral relations and other matters of mutual concern.
					
					 Documents on bilateral cooperation were adopted between the two sides.

articles.title: Russia-China Nuclear Cooperation Goes Well: Official
articles.content:
Russia-China Nuclear Cooperation Goes Well: Official

					 Moscow, October 13 (KCNA) -- Russian Vice Prime Minister Igor Sechin Tuesday said Russia-China cooperation in the nuclear power field is going well in an all-round way.
					
					 Speaking to reporters, Sechin said the two countries had coordinated all the issues related to oil supply and would specify a plan of talks for gas delivery in two weeks.
					
					 Nuclear power remains one of the main fields in bilateral cooperation, he added.

articles.title: China Gives Importance to Education of Servicepersons' Children
articles.content:
China Gives Importance to Education of Servicepersons' Children

					 Beijing, October 13 (KCNA) -- Xu Caihou, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, called for paying importance to the education of servicepersons' children.
					
					 Speaking at a round-table talk on education of servicepersons' children held in Beijing on Tuesday and Wednesday, Xu said the education is related to not only the interests of the servicepersons and their families but also the state and army building.
					
					 To develop the education in a scientific way is of long-term significance in stabilizing sentiments of the people and army, he said. The education should be steadily developed.

articles.title: Chinese Police Proves Successful in Combating Crimes
articles.content:
Chinese Police Proves Successful in Combating Crimes 

					 Beijing, October 13 (KCNA) -- Chinese police organs have successfully carried on a special action against crimes.
					
					 Over the past 45 days since the special action was launched in the country on August 22, they have handled some 36 000 cases under the guidance of the party committees and local governments, relying on the people.
					
					 During the days they have found out 7,165 places of illegal activities and arrested some 17,000 people involved in crimes.

articles.title: Important Days of WPK Observed in Kuwait
articles.content:
Important Days of WPK Observed in Kuwait

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The Kuwaiti preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and the Kuwait-DPRK Friendship Association jointly published a bulletin on Oct. 6 on the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 85th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					
					 The bulletin said that the WPK which greets its 66th anniversary is demonstrating its might as a steel-strong party, invincible party in the international community, adding that this would be unthinkable without the feats of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The President formed the DIU with members of young vanguard, its programme served as a basis of the WPK and young revolutionaries of a new generation trained by the DIU became the backbone for founding the party, it noted.
					
					 He set forth the policy of founding the party at the historic Kalun meeting and energetically made its preparations in the crucible of the anti-Japanese struggle, thus accomplishing the historic cause of party-building without delay after the liberation of Korea, it stressed.
					
					 Praising the 66-year-long history of the WPK as a history of victory and glory in which it has led the people to bring about an epoch-making turn, it said that the WPK has demonstrated its might as a guide of the Songun cause under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Leadership Feats for Party Building Lauded
articles.content:
Leadership Feats for Party Building Lauded

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Newspapers and magazines of different countries carried special write-ups on the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 85th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					
					 The Mongolian newspaper Mongolyn Unen on Oct. 6 carried a photo of President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il and the following article titled "66th Founding Anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea":
					
					 The WPK is demonstrating its might as a dignified invincible party in international arena. This would be unthinkable without the feats performed by the President.
					
					 After embarking upon the road of revolution in his early years, the President mapped out a plan to form a genuine vanguard organization to lead the anti-Japanese national liberation movement and inaugurated the DIU with young revolutionaries of Korea on Oct. 17, 1926.
					
					 The WPK originated from the DIU. 
					
					 The President set forth the policy of party founding at the historic Kalun meeting in 1930 and made brisk preparations for it in the crucible of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					 He founded the WPK on Oct. 10, 1945 after Korea's liberation.
					
					 The feats performed by him will shine forever with the WPK, the organizer and guide of all victories of the Korean people.
					
					 The Thai newspaper Xing San Daily on Oct. 5 devoted one whole page to the article titled "Steady Victories of Workers' Party of Korea and Their Secret" and a portrait of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The paper referred to the secret of the WPK's  demonstration of its might as an ever-victorious party in the international arena, adding that it will always emerge victorious as it is led by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The October issue of the Palestinian magazine Ilal Amam carried "85th Anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union" and other articles with photos of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Oct. 4 Declaration Supported in Britain
articles.content:
Oct. 4 Declaration Supported in Britain

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The British branch of the Korean Friendship Association, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy made public a joint statement on Oct. 3 on the 4th anniversary of the historic October 4 declaration.
					
					 The declaration for implementing the June 15 joint declaration serves as an important milestone for independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and the inter-Korean cooperation, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 However, the south Korean authorities totally denied the above-said declarations and have intensified reckless hostile moves against the DPRK in collusion with foreign forces including the U.S. and Japan.
					
					 They orchestrated all sorts of fabrications against the DPRK and arrested and suppressed pro-reunification patriots in south Korea and many other personages who praised the socialist system of the DPRK.
					
					 We fully support the south Korean people in their struggle to embody the spirit of "By our nation itself" and pull the U.S. forces out of south Korea by implementing the October 4 declaration, stressed the statement.

articles.title: GIs' Crimes Assailed in Brazil
articles.content:
GIs' Crimes Assailed in Brazil

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted an article titled "Increasing GI crimes in south Korea" on its Internet homepage on Oct. 1, accusing the U.S. forces in south Korea of their crimes.
					
					 Recalling that GIs' crimes are further increasing in south Korea recently, the article noted that a GI present in south Korea committed a sexual assault against an 18-year girl student in September.
					
					 The U.S. troops should be withdrawn from south Korea at once as they block the reunification of Korea and constitute the root cause of rendering the situation on the Korean Peninsula tense.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Marked Abroad

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Events took place in Italy, Denmark, Bulgaria and India between Oct. 5 and 6 on the occasions of the 66th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 85th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					
					 On display in the venues of the events were works of President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il, photos showing the exploits performed by the peerlessly great men in founding and developing the WPK, etc.
					
					 A secretary of Rieti Branch of the Communist Party of Italy said that the WPK has wisely led the Korean people at all times as an organizer and guide of all victories, stressing the WPK headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il would achieve greater success in the struggle for the country's prosperity and realizing the cause of reunification while consistently adhering to the revolutionary principle.
					
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, said:
					
					 The WPK has been able to record its history with victories for such a long period as it has regarded the Juche idea as its guiding ideology, holding President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in high esteem.
					
					 No one can block the way before the Korean people as long as there are Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il and the WPK which achieved single-minded unity of all members of the society.
					
					The acting curator of Kim Il Sung Library in Sofia of Bulgaria noted that under the leadership of the WPK the Korean people have turned their country into a socialist power which has firmly adhered to the principle independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence by embodying the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the meetings in Demark and Bulgaria.

articles.title: WPK's Anniversary Observed in Ecuador
articles.content:
WPK's Anniversary Observed in Ecuador

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Ecuador issued a statement on Oct. 5 on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Warmly congratulating the WPK on its birthday, the general secretary said:
					
					 The WPK founding was a historic event.
					
					 The WPK provided the Korean people with a peaceful and creative life.
					
					 Under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung the WPK has waged a positive struggle to protect the people's happiness and peace from the threat of foreign forces present in the southern part of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 General secretary Kim Jong Il has firmly defended the country's sovereignty and led the WPK to discharge its historic mission.
					
					 Availing myself of this significant day, I extend sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Il who has wisely led the WPK for the people's happiness.
					
					 We hope that national reunification, the desire of all Koreans, would be achieved at an early date and successes be achieved in the DPRK's socialist construction.

articles.title: Work Posted on Internet of British Organization
articles.content:
Work Posted on Internet of British Organization

					 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its Internet homepage the full text of general secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On the Fundamentals of Revolutionary Party Building" on the 66th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The work, published on October 10, Juche 81(1992), refers to the historic lesson drawn from the building of a socialist ruling party and the fundamental principle of a Juche-oriented revolutionary party building and clarifies the idea that it is necessary to boost the international unity and solidarity of the revolutionary parties.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige granja de cerdos y fabrica de red
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige granja de cerdos y fabrica de red

					 Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno la Granja de Cerdos Taedonggang y la Fabrica de Red Taedonggang, modernamente construidas.
					
					 En el terreno, el Dirigente fue acogido por el ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo Ri Myong Su, el jefe de la Direccion Politica del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, Ri Pyong Sam y otros funcionarios.
					
					 En primer lugar, el Dirigente dirigio en el terreno la Granja de Cerdos Taedonggang levantada en la zona de la Granja Fruticola Combinada Taedonggang.
					
					 Luego de escuchar las explicaciones ante el plano, recorrio la sala de control general, los corrales de fecundacion y parto, la fabrica de elaboracion de carne y otros lugares interiores y exteriores de la Granja enterandose del estado de construccion, dotacion tecnica, cria y procesamiento de carne.
					
					 Mostrandose muy satisfecho de que los constructores levantaron en un ano y pico esta granja moderna, evaluo altamente los meritos de ellos que hicieron todo lo posible por la prosperidad de la patria.
					
					 Es loable que mediante el aumento de la produccion de abono organico con excrementos de cerdos hayan sentado una firme base para elevar la fertilidad de huerto frutal, dijo y volvio a evaluar que la granja materializa la demanda del partido de establecer el sistema de produccion circular en fruticultura y ganaderia.
					
					 Estuvo satisfecho de la temperatura adecuada de corrales de cerdos y de la ventilacion por medio natural y por ventiladores.
					
					 Expuso alegria de que los constructores de la division del MINSEP de la Brigada de Construccion 618 hayan logrado exitos al investigar e introducir por su propia cuenta el metodo de produccion de ladrillos mediante la calcinacion al aire libre.
					
					 Al darse cuenta de los esfuerzos de los profesores e investigadores de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek, quienes alcanzaron muchos exitos en la aplicacion del propio sistema de control combinado, felicito sus exitos laborales.
					
					 Vio la coleccion de obras y bosquejos que reflejan vividamente la digna vida y abnegacion de los constructores militares, enseno que son orgullosos dibujos creados por el noble mundo espiritual de los seres humanos de nuestra epoca.
					
					 El Dirigente indico las tareas que se presentan en la gestion de la Granja.
					
					 Acto seguido, el Dirigente estuvo en la Fabrica de Red Taedonggang.
					
					 Ante el plano escucho las explicaciones y recorrio  diversos procesos de produccion de la Fabrica, donde hizo conocimiento detallado de los estados de construccion, de equipos tecnicos y de produccion.
					
					 Dijo que la fabrica bien construida con alto nivel de cultura laboral es un precioso patrimonio del pais capaz de producir en gran cantidad y con poca mano de obra las redes necesarias para cubrir los campos frutales y evaluo altamente los esfuerzos de los constructores.
					
					 Al cerciorarse concretamente de la estructura, los principios de funcion y la capacidad de los equipos, se mostro contento de los equipos delicados y de precision.
					
					 Es loable que la fabrica produzca las redes de distintos tipos y colores para utilizar en los campos frutales, el dominio pesquero y otras ramas de la economia nacional y asegurar eficazmente la luz solar segun las condiciones de crecimiento de las frutas.
					
					 La fabrica asume el importante deber de producir y suministrar las redes indispensables tanto para la fruticultura como para otros dominios de la economia nacional, dijo y presento las tareas que incumben a la fabrica. 
					
					 Expuso gran esperanza y conviccion de que los funcionarios y empleados de la fabrica con el espiritu de servicio abnegado para el pueblo registraran mayor auge en la produccion y contribuiran activamente a la mejora de la vida del pueblo.
					
					 Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del Buro Politico y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Pak To Chun y Thae Jong Su, miembros suplentes del Buro Politico y secretarios del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, y Ri Ryong Ha, primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige la Planta de Tortugas Taedonggang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige la Planta de Tortugas Taedonggang

					 Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Planta de Tortugas Taedonggang, construida nuevamente.
					
					 Le acogieron en el mismo lugar el ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo Ri Myong Su, el jefe de la Direccion Politica del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea Ri Pyong Sam, y otros funcionarios.
					
					 Luego de escuchar la explicacion ante el plano, el Dirigente se entero detalladamente del estado de construccion y la cria de tortugas recorriendo la sala de control general, las lagunas de tortugas bajo techo y al aire libre y otros lugares de la planta.
					
					 Al mirar el aspecto de la Planta acondicionada hermosamente como lugar de recreo y las tortugas en las lagunas construidas ordenadamente se mostro muy satisfecho de que los constructores militares hayan construido en el supremo nivel cualitativo la moderna base de cria de tortugas poniendo de pleno manifiesto el espiritu revolucionario de los militares.
					
					 Al enterarse de que es posible criar dentro de un ano una tortuga de mas de 0.5 kg, que para ser la tortuga madre debe crecer durante 4-5 anos en el habitat natural, senalo orgullosamente que la realidad de esta granja muestra practicamente lo que no hay nada imposible para Corea.
					
					 La Planta de Tortugas Taedonggang esta situada en el lugar mas adecuado para criarlas y dotada de los equipos sofisticados, dijo y subrayo que esta es la planta demandada por el partido y la riqueza socialista que posibilita dar beneficio real al pueblo trabajador.
					
					 Gracias a los abnegados esfuerzos de los constructores militares llegaron a producir en gran cantidad las tortugas raras que otrora eran dificiles a verlas, senalo y evaluo repetidamente los meritos de los constructores militares, autenticos defensores y creadores de la felicidad del pueblo.
					
					 Kim Jong Il presento las tareas que se presentan ante dicha planta.
					
					 Ahora solo el comedor especializado de platos del Restaurante Okryu esta de servicio de platos de tortugas a los ciudadanos, pero, la voluntad del partido es hacer que lo hagan en el futuro el Restaurante Chongryu y otros comedores de la ciudad de Pyongyang.
					
					 Apoyandose en la base de produccion preparada ya, la planta debe criar el ano proximo a 25 mil tortugas y cada ano a mas de 100 mil despues de 2-3 anos.
					
					 Debe criar las lanas toros comestibles con las tortugas y los carasios tropicales.
					
					 Debe producir objetos de artes menores con las conchas.
					
					 El Dirigente expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los funcionarios y los empleados de la planta cumpliran con su honrosa mision y deber de servidores del pueblo.
					
					 Le acompanaron Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del Buro Politico y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Pak To Chun y Thae Jong Su, miembros suplentes del Buro Politico y secretarios del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Ri Ryong Ha y Pak Pong Ju, primeros subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: CRPP denuncia radiodifusion anti-RPDC del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
CRPP denuncia radiodifusion anti-RPDC del Sur de Corea

					 Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) hizo publica el dia 14 la informacion no. 984 denunciando al Ministerio titere  de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea que abrio la pagina web "Transmision de reunificacion" con el  objetivo de denigrar la dignidad y el sistema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y embellecer su politica conflictiva contra esta. 
					
					 La nota va como sigue: 
					
					 Recientemente, el Ministerio titere de Reunificacion inicio la "radiodifusion de reunificacion" por via Internet persiguiendo la hostilidad a sus connacionales y el enfrentamiento de sistemas, lo cual deviene un abierto insulto a la aspiracion de toda la nacion a la reunificacion y una grave provocacion contra la RPDC. 
					
					 No estando satisfecho con la demagogia grosera y provocativa anti-RPDC mediante el TV y radiodifusion, que tergiversa la verdad e inculca la hostilidad y la conciencia de enfrentamiento contra los connacionales, el Ministerio titere de Reunificacion utiliza hasta la via Internet como un medio de sus maniobras de enfrentamiento con la RPDC. 
					
					 La banda titere surcoreana cierra los sitios web  que elogia a la RPDC e insiste en la reunificacion pro-Norte mientras recurre  absurdamente a la "creacion de opinion publica favorable a la reunificacion" y a los "preparativos para la reunificacion" a traves de la "radiodifusion de reunificacion".  
					
					 Es una burla intolerable a todos los coreanos el que los enloquecidos por la confrontacion anti-reunificacion soltaran las palabras sagradas como reunificacion. 
					
					 Los "preparativos para la reunificacion" de que habla la banda titere, en su esencia, significan echar la base psicologica para la "unificacion de regimenes" infundiendo a los habitantes surcoreanos la idea de odio a sus connacionales y la conciencia conflictiva anti-RPDC. 
					
					 Tal Ministerio titere de Reunificacion es repudiado merecidamente por distintos sectores y la opinion publica del Sur de Corea como "Ministerio de confrontacion", "Ministerio anti-reunificacion" y "Ministerio intrigante".
					
					 La banda titere recurre a tal alboroto con el malsano intento de justificar su politica conflictiva y  exterminar cada dia mas creciente conciencia de reunificacion pro-Norte de amplios habitantes surcoreanos.
					
					 Pero, esto sera el esfuerzo agonico de la banda titere en apuros de crisis por el fracaso total de la politica conflictiva anti-RPDC y adelantara solo su derrota.
					
					 La banda traidora inutilmente trata de impedir la fuerte corriente hacia la reunificacion independiente valiendose de los aparatos intrigantes de radiodifusion en difamar la digna imagen de la RPDC que sale siempre victoriosa.
					
					 El Ministerio titere de Reunificacion debe poner fin de inmediato a la absurda campana de radiodifusion anti-RPDC en contrapelo de la aspiracion de la opinion publica y la corriente de la epoca.

articles.title: Cuadros directivos presencian Concierto de Octubre
articles.content:
Cuadros directivos presencian Concierto de Octubre

					 Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 13 en el Teatro Unhasu el Concierto de Octubre "Iremos siempre por nuestro camino".
					
					 En la escena de funcion iniciada con la interpretacion del Himno Nacional se pusieron diversas piezas, entre otras, la musica orquestal y solo femenino de canciones en serie "Regazo del partido madre", el cuarteto masculino "Luces del Comite Central del Partido", la musica orquestal "Muchacha en el columpio", la narracion y musica orquestal "Iremos siempre por nuestro camino" y el coro "El Partido del Trabajo es nuestro orientador".
					
					 Los ejecutantes elogiaron las hazanas del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il quienes allanaron e hicieron brillar la nueva historia de la construccion del partido revolucionario jucheano y ofrecieron la firme base para la prosperidad de Corea del Songun.
					
					 Ademas, las piezas del concierto reflejan la absoluta confianza de todo el ejercito y el pueblo en el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y su firme voluntad de acelerar la construccion de la patria rica en acato al espiritu de la Conferencia del PTC.
					
					 Sobre todo, la narracion del epilogo tiene fuerte caracter ideologico y politico y la influencia que permiten conmover a los espectadores.
					
					 Lo vieron los cuadros directivos del Estado, los funcionarios del Consejo de Ministros, organos centrales y sectores de cultura y arte, prensa e informacion, los creadores, artistas, periodistas, hombres de prensa, profesores y estudiantes de rama de ensenanza artistica.
